page.title: 12RELIGION
page.content: {St. Paul's Parish Church}was built in 1846 expecting to be the centre of future habitation from Denholme and Denholme Clough. Still isolated, the church has been divided and the eastern end is used as a meeting room. Regular Sunday services are enhanced by a peal of 8 bells. In l958, a building formerly used by the Salvation Army and as a greengrocery shop, became {St.Peter's {Roman Catholic Church}, and under the auspices of Haworth Church, mass is said each Sunday. In l972 the Independent chapel joined with the Presbyterian church and became the {Denholme United Reformed {Church. }They have a church (a listed building) and a Sunday School. The {Baptist}fraternity meet each Sunday in a room at the Community Centre.
